thread.title: Alex_Richards published Tories call for halt of Exeter's bus station and pool project at...

author: Alex_Richards
title: Alex_Richards published Tories call for halt of Exeter's bus station and pool project at...
text:
Tories call for halt of Exeter's bus station and pool project at meeting - live coverage By Alex_Richards | Posted: July 19, 2017 3 COMMENTS SHARES Comments (3) 
An Extraordinary Meeting of Exeter City Council will see members decide whether to rubber stamp the council's request to spend more on the pool and bus station project. 
Also tonight, Tory opposition on the Labour-led city council, led by Cllr Andrew Leadbetter, will call for the project for the project to be put on hold while a "thorough evaluation and review is instigated into what Exeter actually requires." 
Scroll down for live coverage, reaction and Devon Live's take on the meeting 
They will also urge the council to find ways to reduce the cost of the project, which will stand at nearly £40m when the final approval of that figure is granted. 
Return to Devon Live home page or read next: Exeter college set to build student flats aimed at 16-18 year old's opposite The Imperial 
The cost of St Sidwell's Point now stands at £33.05m, with the replacement bus station an additional £6.87m. The costs estimated at the time the planning applications were approved were £26m and £6.25m. 
The council blames the Brexit vote for the uplift in tender costs and the extra cash will mainly come from Central Government funding.
